title: Future scenarios for freight transport through Alpine area

author: Ana Marija Ljubič, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, University of Maribor

segmentation: First, a little bit words about me.
My name is Anna Maria Lewis.
I come from University of Marburg.
I work in traffic Department with my mentor, Doctor Drago Silver.
I work as a researcher for two years.
Now I'm going to talk about future scenarios for free transport through Alpine area.
I find region is as well no, very considered as a sensitive area.
This area is actually the Europe is worried by the growth of free traffic, which induces significant impacts on the crossing areas through air pollution, noise and noise.
Of course, heavy vehicles are visually very intrusive, noisy, polluting and responsible for much of the in patches behind building strategies.
Overtime the distances over which freight moves have lengthened and the amount of dependence on distant sources and Rd freight operations has increased.

As we all know, in order to understand the forces that currently mold Rd freight traffic operations, we have to be aware of the importance of the spatial distribution of manufacturing and the geographical location.
Such awareness can reveal the beginnings of a new strategy that will move freight transport operations.
In the direction of sustainable development.
Is free transport through Alpine area really growing?
The answer is quick and it says yes.
Road, Fred Rd.
Freight has grown at just over 4% per year over 20 year.
While rail has as we can all see, declined this growth in Rd Freight has been accompanied and stimulated by a number of technological and spatial factors.

We have to realize that every eighth turn that afraid goods in the European Union has to cross the Alps, and of course the majority of freight traffic happens to be on the road due to the EU enlargement in the East Europe traffic will increase drastically, not only 4% even more, the consequences are increased air pollution, more noise pollution for the population and more heavy traffic on the roads.
Again, on the roads, different regulation and nationally grown structures in the countries complicate freight traffic over railway.
Even more key problems relating to freight transport through Alpine area could be summarized as increasing freight traffic on Alpine crossing.
An increasing share of Rd freight transport capacity problem on Rd Network limited capacity of the railway, an intermodal network safety problems on Rd.
And increasing share of environmental burdens of Rd freight.
So fridge transport mainly wrote for it has grown as you could see on previous slide.
It persistently grows at a high rate over the last 20 years, or as a result, the current situation is not sustainable, nor for the economy, nor for SoC, nor for the environment.
Free transport has huge negative impacts on global climate.
Local air quality, natural habitat and biodiversity.
Rd is particularly bad more than real SoC for working conditions.
For Rd transport.
Employees are unfair.
Certain people without access to certain transport means they cannot access basic goods and services and very much citizens are exposed to transport emission.
And Rd transport system is often congested as we all know existing transport infrastructure is not efficiently used.
The Alpine The Alpine chain crossing problem has become an important part of the integrated vision of a free Europe market.
Of course, in particular importances for various countries that have become members of the European Union.
Several background reasons may explain the problem of Alpine Ark.
Open Ark represents some kind of fixed gateway for Southeastern Europe regions as well for Asian and African countries towards central and northern Europe.
Italy, given its geographical situation, surrounded by the Alpine arc as it could be seen or picture from the northern side and by the Mediterranean Sea from the other side.
It represents the critical image for crossing situation.
Existing physical links.
Gateways for this European commercial relationships are the Alpine passes.
They are drawn with the Yellow Road and Black Rail.
They this passes are mainly oriented oriented to the road transport mode.
Since the Alpine arc represents an essential corridor connecting the northern and the southern Europe national borders have incorporated some kind of undeniable physical.
An institutional barriers among different countries, and Moreover among the Alpine countries, whose borders are almost montanus, thus obstructing transport infrastructure.
To balance the increasing international freight mobility training trend.
The above facts clearly illustrate why the efficient and sustainable passing of the Alps has always represented a challenge.
Tranzalpine transport, infrastructure and environmental constraints are presented above.
We have.
As a result, different transit transit modalities that have been developed more Rd than rail and there includes traditional road and rail and more efficient combined transport.
We always talk about intermodal transport.

Up for the integration of transport infrastructure and transport means it seems logical to start with the following activities, setting up the basis for integrated 10 trans European network and nodes.

Harmonization of regulation and competition rules in the transport sector, identification of various types of barriers for Inter modality, implementing the notion of information system and SoC in the transport sector.
Such information system is currently trying to be established for Alpine area with a project of check.

All these activities have to be carried out at the European National and regional level in order to implement a European intermodal transport system in which a user e.g customer oriented its transport services will be provided as a mode independent door to door connections.
Many studies have been developed.
And in the Open Ark, and have emerged in recent years they have been conducted with different methods.
One of the methods is high and lowest scenario alot of projects has been made on this scenarios.
So high scenario is based on such hypothesis as high economic growth, favorable position of rail, improvement of rail capacity.
That's why there are two trains and imposing strict restrictions of the rate heavy traffic.
That's why it stop.
Before the van.
Last scenario is based on moderate economic growth and less favorable rail mode position due to a proper response of the road mode to environmental restrictions.
One of those scenarios could be could be equal points that were introduced in Austria.
And were valid for a limited time until 2003.
Austria was allowed to apply the ecopoint system on a protocol nine.
We have to realize that existing national transport politics are not coordinated between the Alpine countries and not have the overall positive effects.
Negative effects on the other corridor caused by certain measure may outweigh some of the positive effects on the corridor.
Therefore, it is safe to assume that echo points were leading to.
Very undesirable.
Effect.
Other scenarios are cap and trade and slot management.
They represent a mandatory system of tradeable permits to cross the Alpine area with the objective to limit the amount of Alpine freight.
On the road, of course, in economically efficient way way.
That's why the tradeable permits.
The permits could be allocated free or for fixed price or buy an auction.
The auction represents the small efficient allocation form.
After the allocation.
The permits could be traded either directly between the transport operators or by an intermediate or special platform.
The other is slot management.
Slot management is.
Dynamic pricing it would represent a voluntary system which tradeable Anne Price reservation permits.
This is the difference between cap and trade and slot management.

The objective of this system is to improve the use of the existing Rd capacity and reduction of congestion transport operators could buy a reservation right for the reservation reservation which would give them the permission to use, for instance, the Gotthard motorway in certain time slot.
Time slot this system would allow transport operators to better plan their journeys and to reserve a place in the Alpine crossing for time sensitive goods.
Goods that could go bad.
Additional measures are of course needed to restrain transport growth, and in particular to limit the number of heavy duty passing through the Alpine area.
Measures could also include the improvement of logic, logistic infrastructure measures, and the promotion of rail.

So what are the conclusions to make a Long story short, rail mode is targeted as a promising and sustainable option, which is expected to be able to accommodate future growth of need for freight flows.
However, the studies have shown that this will only be possible if huge investments are carried out.

Apart from supporting the operations of combined transport which we talked earlier, these investments are expected to be able to save or even increase the real market share and thus strengthened its position in the tranzalpine transport freight area market, transferring freight from row from Rd to rail is important and will pay play a large part.
Environmental strategies designed to reduce the environmental degradation of hard pressed corridors.
Real has much bigger and larger play in resolving freight capacity problems through Alpine area.
We have to realize nor we do admit that high speed rail is near in the future to be developed and maybe freight will move through.
More than throat.
Thank you.
Thank you, thank you.

Just please.
Your slides.
Is unfavorable.
You have societal reasons in your economic yes, yes.
I think it's opinion, nor no fact not affect personal opinion.
Last from Katie I from Hungary, because the name of this thematic session is future scenario, I my question is about the future.
Do you have or Can you imagine a turning point on the French transport across the air when the railway freight transport performances will increase faster?
Then the road transport performances.
And just that short.
The first European transport policy, the common transport policy, started in 1990.
And it never came out was the director of the DG Transport Batman and his main message was radicalization of the railway.
In the last 20 years that the road transport English much more faster than their way.
So how can we change it?
And Can you imagine a turning point and they can be more competitive across the arms and the road.
Well, again, in my opinion.
First we have to build high speed rail because.
Today are afraid through the rail is very slow.
That's why companies big companies are using Rd not not rail.
Maybe the turning point will be when we have.
So big restrictions in economy way more than environmental way that the road freight transport will be so expensive that they will find another way or no, not door to door importance.
Today the door to door importance is very important and we all know that rail is not capable of that for now.
But if the road will be so expensive that the company will have no.
Chance to pay that.
Freight will go on rail, but first we have to do the infrastructure first infrastructure, then the imposing of large economic restrictions.
